title: Multiply Constant
question_text: Suppose a school nurse measured the weights of $10$ of her students. The weights had a mean of $104\text{ pounds}$ with a standard deviation of $11\text{ pounds}$ . If this data were in kilograms ( $1\text{ lb} = 0.45\text{ kg}$ ), what would the new mean and standard deviation be?

choices.text: Mean = 46.8 kg 46.8 kg ; Standard deviation = 11 kg 11 kg
Mean = 46.8 kg 46.8 kg ; Standard deviation = 4.95 kg 4.95 kg
Mean 104 kg 104 kg ; Standard deviation = 4.95 kg 4.95 kg
Mean = 104 kg 104 kg ; Standard deviation = 11 kg 11 kg
Mean = 46.8 kg 46.8 kg ; Standard deviation = unable to determine
